conclusion: To determine the maximum distance between the two vehicles, analyze their velocities and distances during braking.
The graph shows the velocity of the truck and the bus as functions of time. The truck starts at 40 m/s and decelerates linearly. The bus starts at 30 m/s and also decelerates linearly.
The maximum distance occurs when the truck and bus are traveling at the same velocity during braking.
The truck's velocity decreases from 40 m/s to 0 m/s over 20 seconds. The bus's velocity decreases from 30 m/s to 0 m/s over 30 seconds.
Calculate deceleration rates: Truck = -2 m/s², Bus = -1 m/s².
Set velocities equal: 40 - 2t = 30 - t, solve for t = 10 seconds.
Calculate average velocity of the truck: (40 + 20)/2 = 30 m/s.
Distance traveled by the truck: 30 m/s * 10 s = 300 m.
Calculate average velocity of the bus: (30 + 20)/2 = 25 m/s.
Distance traveled by the bus: 25 m/s * 10 s = 250 m.
Calculate maximum distance: 300 m - 250 m + 30 m = 80 m.
The maximum distance between the two vehicles is 80 meters.
